intro: Paullinia triquetra, commonly known as the three-lobed soursop, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a woody shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and have a distinctive three-leaf structure. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The fruit is a large, spiny berry that contains a single seed and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
